question:
A company runs a critical data analysis job each week before the first day of the work week. The job requires at least 1 hour to complete the analysis. The job is stateful and cannot tolerate interruptions. The company needs a solution to run the job on AWS.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Create a container for the job. Schedule the job to run as an AWS Fargate task on an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) cluster by using Amazon EventBridge Scheduler.
options.B: Configure the job to run in an AWS Lambda function. Create a scheduled rule in Amazon EventBridge to invoke the Lambda function.
options.C: Configure an Auto Scaling group of Amazon EC2 Spot Instances that run Amazon Linux. Configure a crontab entry on the instances to run the analysis.
options.D: Configure an AWS DataSync task to run the job. Configure a cron expression to run the task on a schedule.

explanation: Fargate with ECS provides a containerized, managed solution that can run for over an hour without interruption. Lambda has a 15-minute timeout, Spot Instances can be interrupted, and DataSync is for data transfer, not job processing.
